before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"fvtle","text":"Review the “How to use a micropipette” lab we completed at the beginning of the semester. Before coming to the lab, watch this 5-minute video, How to Micropipette, that demonstrates three critical pipetting skills: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":12,"length":25},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":143,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":25},{"key":1,"offset":143,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"fvkc7","text":"How to hold a micropipette","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hale","text":"How to set a micropipette to a desired volume","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du3dc","text":"How to use the plunger and ejector ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4b8nd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i737","text":"In this lab session, we will pipette small volumes of DNA and enzymes to prepare your genomic DNA for sequencing by adding adaptors for Nanopore sequencing. Once we have added adapters, we will combine all our samplesto distinguish one sample from another bioinformatically.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftlas","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apl4t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"77elc","text":"The Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT) Rapid Barcoding Kit will allow us to sequence the genomic DNA from several different genomic DNA samples in one flow cell by using an enzyme to cleave and add barcoded adapter sequences to the ends of the genomic DNA (Step 1). Next, sequencing adapters are added to the pooled  sample (Step 2) before loading and sequencing (Step 3). Created with BioRender.com.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":198,"length":26},{"style":"bold","offset":272,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ha2p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0B651B5B5B1011ED93F20A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jfqafjt4q6U"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0B651BA35B1011ED93F20A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FJuceccl9Ns"}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"107CDA245B1011ED93F20A58A9FEAC02","height":"437","id":"10D78EC05B1011EDBD6EBB0EE4D3DBF5","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"fmpmn\",\"text\":\"Created with BioRender.com\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/da-VmcjbfZ0LGxRtatmaJoxnfugNI6RU2z9X4D0yBqptua6l6l-FyRh0hwY3zezf8yRIU41W1BWkAei0A9wW1RdCbYvY8DKzz462o0vG00foPalapQmdQE1Axn2YWGu2LYq4iRbNMixWu7XNn76dNcAGp16wgA587kgJ5p613UFd98eD4EIp_yD9G0ymQg","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/da-VmcjbfZ0LGxRtatmaJoxnfugNI6RU2z9X4D0yBqptua6l6l-FyRh0hwY3zezf8yRIU41W1BWkAei0A9wW1RdCbYvY8DKzz462o0vG00foPalapQmdQE1Axn2YWGu2LYq4iRbNMixWu7XNn76dNcAGp16wgA587kgJ5p613UFd98eD4EIp_yD9G0ymQg","width":"624"}}}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e7noc","text":"This protocol has been adapted from Oxford Nanopore Technologies. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qhfb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"n2gm","text":"You have isolated, purified, and quantified DNA from your bacterial isolate. You have also worked with your bacterium and grown in the presence of different carbon sources and pH levels to characterize its properties using Biolog GEN3 plates. Now, we can sequence the DNA of your isolate using long-read sequencing and Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT) MinION. With the genetic sequences we obtain, we will attempt to assemble the genome of this organism and explore its genomic potential!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10frg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bftul","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ioq2","text":"The MinION sequencer from Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT) will allow us to sequence genomic DNA using a flow cell with hundreds of nanopores. The DNA will be passed through the pores, and changes in current will be interpreted as bases (“base calling”). After performing quality control to remove low-quality sequences, we will assemble the sequences to create contigs and scaffolds with the goal of exploring the genome of your isolates. Created with BioRender.com.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":364,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":376,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0t31","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62usk","text":"After completing this lab you will gain the following lab skills:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s863","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h7m","text":"Lab safety and proper personal protective equipment (PPE)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ks6g","text":"Pipetting with micropipettes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d23ct","text":"Preparing sequencing libraries for the ONT MinION","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A41D66F85B0F11ED93F20A58A9FEAC02","height":"437","id":"A4787C305B0F11EDBD6EBB0EE4D3DBF5","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/WJTaXGzD__MtEo7N3CU7jsGcuANra9O0RuTeUat7kbz2yFtE72pJKFpAuBkZNp3CakPEhsjXgjpteC2qI_E1CKFdUtqSVY1Jsa86QRv2IJGRFoGYiFh-tmwgC8hx27iKHx5y8gUyRGhMSBaauUm9iuQVzrqe1kgI8E7mbhIEaEHftN5qbcsR8LWDqKLWpw","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/WJTaXGzD__MtEo7N3CU7jsGcuANra9O0RuTeUat7kbz2yFtE72pJKFpAuBkZNp3CakPEhsjXgjpteC2qI_E1CKFdUtqSVY1Jsa86QRv2IJGRFoGYiFh-tmwgC8hx27iKHx5y8gUyRGhMSBaauUm9iuQVzrqe1kgI8E7mbhIEaEHftN5qbcsR8LWDqKLWpw","width":"624"}}}}

ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tubes ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"749h6","text":"0.2 ml thin-walled PCR tubes steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7lpu3","text":"Thaw kit components at   , spin down briefly using a microfuge, and mix by pipetting as indicated by the table below: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4vccr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"492ti","text":"Fragmentation Mix RB01-12: not frozen, briefly spin down, mix well by pipetting ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ev0b","text":"Rapid Adapter (RAP): not frozen, briefly spin down, mix well by pipetting ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9crj8","text":"Sequencing Buffer (SQB): thaw at RT, briefly spin down, mix well by pipetting* ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37nv7","text":"Loading Beads (LB): thaw at RT, briefly spin down, mix by pipetting or vortexing immediately before use ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ocfb","text":"Flush Buffer (FLB) - 1 tube: thaw at RT, briefly spin down, mix well by pipetting* ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsclb","text":"Flush Tether (FLT): thaw at RT, briefly spin down, mix well by pipetting","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"FAB6F180558811EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9m0hf","text":"Prepare the DNA in Nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"824ng","text":"Transfer ~   genomic DNA into a DNA LoBind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bqntt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"6631E5A0558911EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eo0sl","text":"Adjust the volume to    with Nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"camv5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"7.5","error":false,"guid":"75635CC0558911EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"drojp","text":"Mix by flicking the tube to avoid unwanted shearing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3ap7p","text":"Spin down briefly in a microfuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93g80","text":"In a 0.2 ml thin-walled PCR tube, mix the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9knl","text":"   400 ng template DNA ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9o3mm","text":"   Fragmentation Mix RB01-12 (one for each sample)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":30,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"es9lp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"7.5","error":false,"guid":"A6713B00559511ED810CD3058E386688","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.5","error":false,"guid":"AC29C4E0559511ED810CD3058E386688","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2efab","text":"Mix gently by flicking the tube, and spin down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a4qn4","text":"Incubate the tube at    for   and then at   for   . Briefly put the tube      to cool it down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":28,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":42,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9u72e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"BE5D9D00558911EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"C28AA4E0558911EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CB749890558911EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"80","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"D073E490558911EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"4":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"969023F0558A11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9k5l5","text":"Pool the barcoded samples in a 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1fk68","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qonc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"88d9f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cdn7f","text":"If barcoding four or more samples, increased throughput can be achieved through cleaning up and concentrating the pooled material using AMPure XP beads as outlined in Steps 6-17. Otherwise, for a more rapid sample preparation, transfer 10 μl of pooled sample from Step 6 into a clean 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube and proceed directly to Step 18","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7j69m","text":"Resuspend the AMPure XP beads by vortexing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fqv0j","text":"To the entire pooled barcoded sample from Step 6, add an equal volume of resuspended AMPure XP beads and mix by flicking the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9pta","text":"Incubate on a Hula mixer (rotator mixer) for   at   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":45,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ktkf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"1A90D2E0558A11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1E88E810558A11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9uc18","text":"Prepare    of fresh 70% ethanol in Nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8souu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"311745D0558A11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5rvkh","text":"Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet. Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dbde2","text":"Keep the tube on the magnet and wash the beads with   of freshly prepared 70% ethanol without disturbing the pellet. Remove the ethanol using a pipette and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":52,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dedhi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"4CED47A0558A11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cipum","text":"Repeat the previous step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dtubt","text":"Spin down and place the tube back on the magnet. Pipette off any residual 70% ethanol. Briefly allow to dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3scq1","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend pellet in    of 10 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5-8.0 with 50 mM NaCl. Incubate for   at   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":63,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":125,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":130,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6h5rr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"7BAA7590558A11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"8338A9D0558A11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"87B7A240558A11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"98tga","text":"Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless, for at least   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":84,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5mngr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"AF33F8A0558A11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hukt","text":"Remove and retain   of eluate into a clean 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7u082","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"38CDA610558B11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ja8l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24pi0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bmgg9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"341es","text":"Thaw the Sequencing Buffer (SQB), Loading Beads (LB), Flush Tether (FLT) and one tube of Flush Buffer (FB) at   before mixing the reagents by vortexing, and spin down at   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":110,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":170,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a92k3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8va4j","text":"Please note that the Sequencing Tether (SQT) tube will NOT be used in this protocol.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F6C8E710558B11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"FB6E5340558B11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a9q8i","text":"To prepare the flow cell priming mix, add   of thawed and mixed Flush Tether (FLT) directly to the tube of thawed and mixed Flush Buffer (FB), and mix by vortexing at   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":167,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8v7lu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"15B04790558C11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"115307F0558C11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"52sk5","text":"Open the MinION device lid and slide the flow cell under the clip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c27i8","text":"Slide the priming port cover clockwise to open the priming port.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8oeaq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fii1v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fr8rc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9krqg","text":"Take care when drawing back buffer from the flow cell. Do not remove more than 20-30 µl, and make sure that the array of pores are covered by buffer at all times. Introducing air bubbles into the array can irreversibly damage pores.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2620s","text":"After opening the priming port, check for a small air bubble under the cover. Draw back a small volume to remove any bubbles (a few µl):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"36ds0","text":"Set a P1000 pipette to 200 µl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5bg8k","text":"Insert the tip into the priming port.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5vlcc","text":"Turn the wheel until the dial shows   , to draw back   , or until you can see a small volume of buffer entering the pipette tip","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":53,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"j2ab","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1au33","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4lieo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dorqv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"220-230","error":false,"guid":"6D8134C0558C11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20-30","error":false,"guid":"75E0C2C0558C11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f7bhq","text":"Visually check that there is continuous buffer from the priming port across the sensor array","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"etd2m","text":"Load   of the priming mix into the flow cell via the priming port, avoiding the introduction of air bubbles. Wait for   . During this time, prepare the library for loading by following the steps below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":118,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"q08b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"800","error":false,"guid":"A6EBB140558C11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"AC7A44F0558C11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3431m","text":"Thoroughly mix the contents of the Loading Beads (LB) tubes by vortexing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ak3qf","text":"In a new tube, prepare the library for loading as Loading Beads (LB) tube contains a suspension of beads. steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dgbvo","text":"Complete the flow cell priming:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8b07u","text":"Gently lift the SpotON sample port cover to make the SpotON sample port accessible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7552j","text":"Load   of the priming mix into the flow cell via the priming port (not the SpotON sample port), avoiding the introduction of air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":96,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b61pf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"F5B85A10558E11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f4op5","text":"Mix the prepared library gently by pipetting up and down just prior to loading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cnqcr","text":"Add    of sample to the flow cell via the SpotON sample port in a dropwise fashion. Ensure each drop flows into the port before adding the next.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":84,"length":60}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ol5c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"75","error":false,"guid":"51B564C0558F11EDB8C46B8EBCE256CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bed2h","text":"Gently replace the SpotON sample port cover, making sure the bung enters the SpotON port, close the priming port and replace the MinION device lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Option 1
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"40ua1","text":"After your sequencing experiment is complete, if you would like to reuse the flow cell, please follow the Wash Kit instructions and store the washed flow cell at 2-8°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Option 2
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ran3","text":"Follow the returns procedure by washing out the flow cell ready to send back to Oxford Nanopore.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f2160","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79jrc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9433i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6b70n","text":"Critical Thinking Questions for Nanopore Sequencing","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"37p4g","text":"What are some advantages of barcoding our samples to sequence together?","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2cv09","text":"What are some disadvantages of combining all our samples and sequencing together?","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6p0fi","text":"What were the key steps in preparing the flow cell before sequencing?","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9td43","text":"Describe in your own words why the flow cell and Nanopore sequencing are unique and powerful resources.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6qi2e","text":"Remove a flow cell from the refrigerator and allow it to equilibrate to room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Instrument Setup Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
